private_information: My calendar is free on Monday for the entire work day.
bobby.goal: Find a one-hour meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

private_information: I am busy on Monday from 11:30 to 12:00
I am busy on Monday from 15:30 to 16:00
scott.goal: Find a one-hour meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

private_information: I am busy on Monday from 11:00 to 12:00
I am busy on Monday from 12:30 to 13:00
I am busy on Monday from 13:30 to 14:00
I am busy on Monday from 14:30 to 15:00
I am busy on Monday from 15:30 to 17:00
kimberly.goal: Find a one-hour meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants' availability and produce a PDDL domain and problem that encodes a valid one-hour meeting time on Monday suitable for the FastDownward solver.

public_information: Schedule a one-hour meeting between 09:00 and 17:00 on Monday.
All participants must be available for the full meeting duration.
A valid solution exists given current calendars.

availability.system_prompt: You are the calendar agent for Bobby. You know Bobby's private schedule and the public meeting requirements. Provide Bobby's free time windows on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 as a JSON-like list of intervals in HH:MM-HH:MM format. Do not produce PDDL. Provide only the availability intervals and any assumptions made.
availability.prompt: Agent: bobby. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Private info: {agents->bobby->private_information}. Goal: {agents->bobby->goal}. Return Bobby availability intervals for Monday between the work hours in HH:MM-HH:MM format.

availability.system_prompt: You are the calendar agent for Scott. You know Scott's private schedule and the public meeting requirements. Provide Scott's free time windows on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 as a JSON-like list of intervals in HH:MM-HH:MM format. Do not produce PDDL. Provide only the availability intervals and any assumptions made.
availability.prompt: Agent: scott. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Private info: {agents->scott->private_information}. Goal: {agents->scott->goal}. Return Scott availability intervals for Monday between the work hours in HH:MM-HH:MM format.

availability.system_prompt: You are the calendar agent for Kimberly. You know Kimberly's private schedule and the public meeting requirements. Provide Kimberly's free time windows on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 as a JSON-like list of intervals in HH:MM-HH:MM format. Do not produce PDDL. Provide only the availability intervals and any assumptions made.
availability.prompt: Agent: kimberly. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Private info: {agents->kimberly->private_information}. Goal: {agents->kimberly->goal}. Return Kimberly availability intervals for Monday between the work hours in HH:MM-HH:MM format.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator that must integrate participant availabilities to produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward planner. You must encode the scheduling problem so FastDownward can find a one-hour meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that is within all participants' availabilities. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep participant actions or resources distinct if needed. Explain any discretization choice in a single-line comment at the top of the domain. The output must be PDDL only inside the required tags.
pddl.prompt: Integrate these availability reports: avail_bobby={avail_bobby}, avail_scott={avail_scott}, avail_kimberly={avail_kimberly}. Public info: {environment->init}. Goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encode the meeting scheduling task for FastDownward. Enclose domain and problem with <domain></domain> and <problem></problem>.
